elements.text: PART ONE
SCENE 1: EXT. ALIEN FOREST. NIGHT
(FX: ALIEN FOREST AMBIENCE. UNDER THAT, THE EERIE, WHISPERED
GIBBERING OF THE SHADES, BLOWING THROUGH THE LANDSCAPE LIKE A
BREEZE. )
(FX: WE HEAR THREE PEOPLE APPROACHING, TRAMPING THROUGH UNDERGROWTH, THE NOISE HALTING AS —)
Hold tight. There’s a view down to the river from this clearing. We might see them from here.
FX: ONE PERSON TRAMPING ON UNTIL —
Sesha, I said hold tight.
(STOPPED) The night-lighter won’t have the range, Mertil. The Takers had too much of a head start.
This was your father’s own strategy. He knew the Takers would return. This is our chance to take the fight to them.
But if they’ve reached the river with him, we’ll have lost him.
It.. might be worth a look. We might see tracks they’ve left.
Hervey, we must keep going. We might catch them up.
Set up the night-lighter, boy. Wait — hand scrub first.
We don’t have time for that!
We won’t help Anulf by falling sick now. Do it — both of you.
(FX: SCOOSH OF HAND SANITISER DISPENSERS AND SCRUBBING OF HANDS. IN THE PAUSE, BRING UP THE SOUND OF THE SHADES A LITTLE LOUDER)
Listen. Lots of Shades about.
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 3
They’re always out in force when the Takers come.
The forest’s alive with them tonight.
They can’t hurt you. Come on, the night-lighter.
FX: SWITCHES FLICKED, LOW HUM
Too many shadows... No, hold tight — is that...?
It’s only Jestan’s group. Must be trying to head the Takers off.
Try to the east, boy.
I’m telling you, Mertil, this is a waste of time. Don’t you want Anulf to be found? (BEAT) Do what you want. I’m going.
Brother Anulf ruled that only groups of three or more were allowed in the forest.
After what happened to your mother, Sesha, I’m surprised [you’d
That’s Sister Sesha. Right now, I decide what’s allowed in the Bay, Mertil. If anything happens to Brother Anulf, powers of governing pass to his first-born. Not to his second wife.
You have emergency powers only.
And this is an emergency. Or do you need the night-lighter to show you that too?
SESHA STORMS AWAY THROUGH THE UNDERGROWTH
Sister Sesha!
She has no respect for anything. For the sake of Purity, I hope the situation is soon resolved.
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 4
(FX: THE NOISE OF THE SHADES GETS SLOWLY LOUDER UNDER DIALOGUE TO END OF SCENE)
No one Taken has ever been found.

Anulf was still strong, boy. He will have resisted, slowed them down. And the Shades trail the Takers. We’ll get to Jestan’s group, get them and any others to search areas with the most Shades. Maybe this time we’ll finally find out where they hide, and deal with them once and for all. Bring the night-lighter. (BEAT) Scrub first.
But I just did.
Do it properly this time. Not just your fingers.
(FX: THE SCOOSHING OF THE SANITISER, SCRUBBING OF HANDS, THE
NOISE OF THE SHADES)
The Shades can’t hurt us. But this dirt, boy. The unclean air. The muck all around us — that’s different. Scrub harder. If we drop our guard... that’s when we’re dead.
SCENE 2: EXT. ELSEWHERE IN ALIEN FOREST. NIGHT
(FX: TARDIS LANDS. EXTERIOR TARDIS DOOR OPENS. THE SOUND OF THE
HAS DROPPED FROM LAST SCENE BUT GRADUALLY INCREASES
THIS ONE)
Ah. Step carefully, you three. We’ve landed at night.
Shall I fetch the torches, Doctor?
No need, Nyssa. That moon’s looking fairly full. Just wait for your eyes to adjust.
It’s a forest.
Thanks for pointing that out, Turlough. Where are we?
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 5
A long way from the Earth, Tegan. This is the planet of Chodor, out on the eastern edge of Aldebaran. No strategic importance, no mineral wealth, overlooked by most travellers.
Is there any particular reason why we’re here?
I suggested to the TARDIS she have a little listen-in on the mutterings of the universe.. Asked her to prick up her metaphorical ears at any mention of Richter’s Syndrome.
Can the TARDIS really do that?
We'll find out, once we’ve explored a little.
Exploring a dark forest in the middle of the night on a world where anyone we meet might have space-rabies?
They won’t, not once I’ve tried out the cure.
She hopes.
I’m grateful for your help, all of you.
FX: SHADES GET SUDDENLY LOUDER AND STAY AT THIS LEVEL
What’s that noise?
I’m not sure. Some kind of atmospheric disturbance?
It’s almost like... voices.
Probably just this planet’s version of cicadas, ov...
Or something else.
(THEN, IN THE DISTANCE THEY HEAR ANULF, WHO’S BEING MANHANDLED
BY SILENT ASSAILANTS )
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 6
I won’t be taken. Do you hear me? I won’t let you. [Why do you do this? Why take so many from Purity, always in silence? ]
Someone’s in trouble.
Come on.
DOCTOR & TEGAN RUN FROM CLEARING
(CALLS) Is that wise? (GRAB’S NYSSA’S ARM) Nyssa, wait!
Turlough, let go of my arm-!
But we don’t know the whole situation!
We never will if we don’t investigate — agh.
FX: NOISE OF SHADES INTENSIFIES, PANNING LEFT AND RIGHT
Are you all right? What is it?
Those sounds in the air.. Don’t you hear them? Like... whispers...
FX: SHADES GET LOUDER, MORE MULTI-LAYERED
The noises are coming from that direction. They’re coming at us!
FX: TURLOUGH RATTLES TARDIS DOOR
And the TARDIS is locked. Oh, wonderful.
We have to get away.
Well come on, then!
THEY RUN
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 7
SCENE 3: EXT. CLIFFTOP FROM ALIEN FOREST. NIGHT
(DOCTOR AND TEGAN CRASH THROUGH FOLIAGE AND STOP RUNNING, A
SHORT OF BREATH)
FX: ABOVE THE AMBIENCE, THE CRASH AND ROLL OF AN OCEAN
Hello?
He’s stopped shouting, we’ve got nothing to follow. You don’t think he went over the cliff edge and drowned?
It sounded to me more as though he were taken deeper into the forest...
FX: SLOW BUILD OF SHADE NOISE
I should've let Nyssa bring the torches — (BEAT) Where IS Nyssa?
Miles behind, I expect. With Turlough.
Oh, well, I’m sure they’1ll be along in just a moment. (CALLS) Nyssa! Turlough!
Ssh! Those sounds in the air again.. like whispers...
(FX: OFF, SESHA CRASHING THROUGH FOREST. SHADES NOISE RECEDES
NEXT FEW LINES)
Ah, I hear them now! (CALLING) Nyssa, Turlough, over here —
(SESHA APPEARS FROM THE UNDERGROWTH. THROUGHOUT THIS SCENE SHE IS FIGHTING TO STAY TOUGH AND DETACHED WHILE OUT OF HER DEPTH)
(SHOCKED) Hold tight.
Oh! Er — hello!
In Sir John’s name, what are you?
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 8
Friendly. There’s no need to be afraid. Come closer. We’re not armed, you can put down the club and the... (SNIFFS) soap?
(SOTTO) Smells like carbolic. (REACTS TO SESHA’S APPEARANCE,
FORWARD) Your skin! It looks burned, are you all right?
Stay back. I am Sister Sesha, Sesha of Anulf.
(SOTTO) She’s a nun?
(SOTTO) Or a nurse.
(AGGRESSIVE) With my father gone, I am Purity Bay’s Leader. Are you Takers?
We haven’t taken anything.
Only the time to see if we could help a man we heard calling for help.
(BREATHES) Father? (STILL SUSPICIOUS) Who are you?
I’m the Doctor.
A doctor? That’s impossible.
Really? Who do you call when you’re sick?
‘Doctor’ is an ancient name of power. There have been no doctors for so long. It is impossible.
Well, as Aristotle said: a likely impossibility is always preferable to an unconvincing possibility.
(MOCKING) You’1ll tell me next she’s Sir John.
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 9
I’m Tegan. Tegan Jovanka.
Sir John is another ancient name of power, I take it.
Where are you from?
Here and there.
We’re travellers. (STEPS FORWARD) Pleased to meet you —
Get back. You must be with the Takers. What have you done with my father?
I’m sorry, we know nothing about these Takers — (BEAT) Ev... Sister Sesha?
(FASCINATED) Your skin, it’s like newborns’...
Er, thanks.
And your hair, it’s so long. It breaks every law. What about
dirt, germs, infection...
I’m afraid I don’t follow.
Whoever or whatever you are — you should be dead.
SCENE 4: EXT. CLEARING IN ALIEN FOREST. NIGHT
(NYSSA HAS FINALLY CAUGHT UP WITH TURLOUGH RUNNING THROUGH THE FOREST. THEY’VE BOTH STOPPED. OUT OF BREATH. )
FX: THE NOISE OF THE SHADES QUIET MURMURS NOW
Nyssa, finally! What’s wrong with you?
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 10
I could hear them.. The Shades... Not clearly, but the sound of words.
You’re not making sense.
The whispering things — the Shades. I think that’s what they call themselves.
Why would you think that?
I half-heard so many words... like someone was trying to force the sounds through my ears. (SIGHS) I just need to rest a moment.
I don’t suppose a moment matters. We’ve lost the Doctor and Tegan completely by now. Still, at least we got away from your Shades.
No.
What d’you mean? The muttering’s all but stopped. Your Shades have gone.
But we didn’t get away from them. The Shades simply... lost interest.
FX: TWIG SNAPPING, OFF
What was that?
NYSSA3: What?
I thought... I thought someone was there... watching.
You’re getting jumpy.
FX: CROSS TO:
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 11
SCENE 5: EXT. ADJACENT TO CLEARING. NIGHT.
BREATHLESS AND AFRAID, HERVEY COMES RUNNING UP TO MERTIL
(WHISPERS) Mertil, you were right, there are.. Sir John heal me, there are strangers.
They made enough noise. They cannot fear discovery. (BEAT) Hervey, fetch the search party here. I will stay to watch them. If they leave, I will mark the trees to show the path.
But if they see you, they might kill you.
Go! Hurry, boy.
HERVEY runs off
FX: THE FAMILIAR SCOOSH OF SANITISER AND SCRUBBING
(WHISPERS) I cannot be hurt. Let doctors see my skin is pure. Let Sir John’s blade show my heart is pure. (SCRUBS HARDER, IT HURTS). I... am pure.
SCENE 6: EXT. CLIFFTOP FROM ALIEN FOREST. NIGHT
Sister Sesha, please don’t let cultural differences blind you to the fact that Tegan and I are trying to help you.
We’re not plague carriers.
And if my hair offends you, I’1ll wear a hat. (PULLS OUT HAT AND
IT) How’s that? However our appearance might differ from yours, you really have nothing to fear.
I’m not afraid. (BEAT) The Shades have moved on - that’s a sure Sign the Takers have gone too.
Shades? The funny noise in the air, you mean?
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 12
So there are no Shades where you come from, as well as no scrubs...
What are they? These Shades?
They can’t hurt you, ‘Doctor’. (SHE ENJOYS USING THE WORD OF POWER, PRONOUNCES IT SLIGHTLY ODDLY) I must return to the hunt. If I don’t find my father tonight...
Please. Let us help you.
No. Hold tight here. I shall be back to speak with you again.
EXITS
Bye, then. (TO DOCTOR) Well, come on then, Doctor. Now’s our chance.
Chance...?
Couldn’t we just slip away, find Nyssa and Turlough, get back to the TARDIS?
We could. But if Nyssa and Turlough are lost out there with these Takers, Sesha’s support could be important to us.
Come off it. You just want to dig around this Purity Bay of theirs and find out what’s going on.
I’d say there was something rotten in the state of Chodor, wouldn’t you?
Rotten? Sterilised to within an inch of its life, you mean. Sesha can’t be more than, what, eighteen? But her skin, it’s like burned leather. And that chemical sme1l..
Mmm. A lifetime of scrubbing with carbolic. I wonder — could it be linked to Richter’s Syndrome?
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 13
SCENE 7: EXT. CLEARING IN ALIEN FOREST. NIGHT
Those sounds have receded. It must be safe to move on.
FX: RUSTLING IN THE UNDERGROWTH, OFF
Turlough, what you said about us being watched...
Yes-?
You weren’t imagining it.
(FX: BURSTING THROUGH UNDERGROWTH) Hold-!
It’s alright, we mean you no harm —
Not you, the man.
M-me?
Step forward! A cap of red... Then the stories are true. Never thought I’d see with my own eyes.
Perhaps if you put down the club we could talk about this.
Where is Brother Anulf, red-thatch? Where have you taken him?
I have no idea what you’re talking about!
Please, we’ve only just arrived here.
Yes, from the Lands Beyond the River. The Taker — and his acolyte.
Your face, your hands, they’re bleeding.
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 14
My purity shines in beads of blood, girl. The Takers will never come for me. Never.
(SOTTO TO NYSSA) Is she suffering from this illness of yours?
(SOTTO) I don’t think so. (TO MERTIL) My name is Nyssa, [and —]
I don’t want your filthy name. If you’ve already taken Brother Anulf, why do you wait? Who else have you come for? Well?
FX: DISTANT RUSTLING FROM UNDERGROWTH
Turlough, she’s trying to keep us here. There are others
coming.
And we'll kill you! (STRAINS AS SHE SWINGS THE CLUB)
Turlough, look out!
TURLOUGH DODGES BACKWARDS
FX: IMPACT OF CLUB STRIKING TREE
Her club’s stuck in the tree. Run, Turlough-!
I’m running! (THEY RUN)
Come back here, red-thatch!
(FX: JESTAN’S SEARCH PARTY APPROACHING THROUGH UNDERGROWTH, OFF)
(OFF, CALLS) Mertil?
Jestan, at last! Bring your men and the spark wire. Hurry,
they’re getting away!
(TO OTHERS) Fan out, men. Follow the Takers!
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 15
FX: THE MEN CRASH OFF
(APPR MERTIL) Thank Sir John, you were not taken yourself.
The Taker’s hair was truly red, Jestan. So much of it. And his skin, so pale. Unnatural.
And Anulf?
We must follow them, Jestan. And scour the truth from them.
SCENE 8: EXT. FOREST PATH. NIGHT
FX: FADE UP. SESHA APPROACHES
(NERVOUS) S-someone there-?
Hold tight, Hervey.
(RELIEF) Sesha, it’s you — (CORRECTING SELF) Sister Sesha, I mean. You won’t believe what’s happened. Mertil and me, we found two Takers.
What? Was my father with them?
I don’t know. Jestan and the others went off after them. I waited for you here.
I must go. I have to see.
(PULLING HER BACK) Sesha, wait. You’re needed at the Bay.
Why’s that?
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 16
Garr came, said that with Anulf taken, and you and Mertil both searching, the people need reassurance that Anulf’s closest haven’t been taken too. They’re afraid, Sesha. They need a leader.
Mertil’s right, I only have emergency powers. They need my father.
Isn’t it better they get you right now, and not Mertil?
I’m glad to hear you say that. I thought when you stayed with her...
I wanted to go with you. Like I wanted to go with Jestan and the others. (PAUSE) I’m just scared, Sesha.
We all are. I suppose I had better go back. And take my news with me.
News?
Not now. I must think of the implications. My mind is spinning... (SIGHS) Imagine if we stopped an actual Taker. If we could only find out what they want with us... What they do...
You should have an escort back to the Bay.
No. I’1ll go alone. But promise me, Hervey, you’1ll bring word of my father. As soon as you get it?
Soon as. Hold tight, Sesha. Sir John’s hand be steady over you.
And you. Hold tight.
SHE EXITS
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 17
SCENE 9: EXT. CLIFFTOP FROM ALIEN FOREST. NIGHT
DOCTOR AND TEGAN ARE WAITING FOR SESHA
(SIGHS) I’ve got such a headache.
Hmm. Proximity to those Shades, perhaps. The fluctuations in their speech and volume suggest their presence bleeds over multiple carrier wavelengths...
That’s not helping the ache, Doctor. (FX: WE HEAR SESHA APPROACH) Here comes Sesha, p’raps you can test out your theories on her.
(TO SESHA) Well, here we are, where you left us.
Good. (PAUSE) I’m taking you to the Bay. We’ve never lost our leader to the Takers before, the people need reassurance.
I’m not surprised. This whole place gives me the creeps. (PAUSE) Don’t you think the sight of us strolling into town might finish your people off?
Your arrival must be properly handled. (PAUSE) I need to know. Doctor, Tegan... are you from the Section?
What section?
An expedition left Purity a hundred years ago. They didn’t come back.
You mean nobody looked for them?
We must always stay close to the Bay. Hold tight — the most important law.
Hold tight to what exactly?
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 18
To Purity. To the hope that we will be rescued and taken back to the stars. If you’re not from the Section, ‘Doctor’... are you here to rescue us?
Well, I — er...
What the Doctor means is: we’ll help if we can.
SCENE 10: EXT. RIVERSIDE. NIGHT
FX: RIVER FLOWING FAST NEARBY
(RUN TO STOP) A river! Where to now-?.
(STOPPED) Sounds like rapids up ahead. We’1l be cut off.
Well, we can’t stay here.
Perhaps if we tried to talk to them?
We did. They talked back with blunt instruments, remember?
FX: SEARCHERS CRASHING THROUGH UNDERGROWTH
They’re getting closer.
FX: MORE CRASHING PANNED TO OPPOSITE DIRECTION
NYSSA3: Wait. There are more ahead of us.
A different search party. We’re trapped.
The river, then. We’ll have to wade across.
PURITY by Stephen Cole
Page 19
But it stinks! And we’ve no idea what creatures might be in
there...
Where else can we go?
If I must —
FX: THEY STEP INTO WATER. CROSS TO:
(RUSHING TO RIVERSIDE) There they are, in the water. on the spark wire. Use the sling-stones. Get them!
FX: CROSS BACK TO:
Never mind the smell, Turlough, swim for it!
THEY DIVE FORWARD, START SWIMMING
FX: STONES, STICKS ETC BEING THROWN IN WATER
(SWIMMING) What are they throwing?
(SWIMMING) Anything they can find. Swim faster.
FX: CLUNK AS TURLOUGH IS STRUCK ON HEAD WITH STONE
CRIES OUT
(TREADING WATER) Turlough? Turlough!
No
range
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 20
SCENE 11: EXT. FOREST PATH. NIGHT
SESHA, DOCTOR, TEGAN WALKING
The path leads straight to the Bay.
But will we be entering it as your prisoners?
Sesha?
I don’t believe you are Takers.
Who are these ‘Takers’?
They’ve never been seen, not properly. They walk like men, but are more than men - so the stories go. But whenever one of us is made too weak by wounds or illness — he or she is Taken.
Bodysnatchers?
Impatient ones, it seems.
Sounds like they really do need more doctors here.
Anyone who’s taken is never seen or heard of again.
Without exception?
(CLOSE TO TEARS) Without exception. I — I was so angry with Father for marrying Mertil so soon... so soon after... (SWALLOWS BACK THE HURT) Forgive me.
It’s alright. Better out than in.
How long has this been going on?
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 21

For always. Or as long as anyone can remember. Like the Shades. (FX: SHADE CHITTER) But they don’t do anything. The elders say they’re the remains of everyone who was ever Taken... their unclean souls barred from heaven.
So your Elders don’t really know any more than us.
You don’t believe them?
Do you?
Wounds become dirty. Sickness brings death. And cleanliness is next to godliness.
What happened to your father?
Sickness in his chest.
His heart? Then you must’ve know the Takers would come for him.
We left guards on watch at his bedside. Prepared alarms. It made no difference. The Takers made them sleep and took him.
Despite the floodlighting. I assume that’s our destination ahead?
Yes. That is Purity Bay. Somehow, I’ve got to be its leader. So
suddenly it matters, doesn’t it?
What you believe in, you mean?
Yes. But what do I believe in?
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 22
SCENE 12: EXT. RIVERSIDE. NIGHT
FX: SOMEONE APPROACHES FROM FOREST
Mertil!
Well, Jestan?
Couldn’t get close enough for the spark-wire. They went into the water — and it didn’t kill them!
Unnatural, evil creatures.
We hit the Taker square on his red head. The girl screamed and then the current swept them away from us. They must be dead... Gone the same way as Sesha’s mother.
These creatures are different from us, they thrive on filth and corruption. If they live, there may be... reprisals.
What should we do?
I will return to Purity, to give my husband’s people comfort at this difficult time. (BEAT) My late husband’‘s people...
Ze
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 23
SCENE 13: EXT. PURITY BAY. NIGHT
Tegan, Doctor — we’re not far from the boundary now. It’s guarded. You’d better wait here.
Keeping us your little secret?
I don’t want people glimpsing you and rumours spreading. I want to announce you properly. To reassure people you’re here to rescue us.
We don’t have magic wands to wave, Sesha. If we’re to help you we need to know where your people came from, what they’re doing...
What’s that building there? Looks sort of... pre-fabricated.
It is the rest centre. The exercise centre is beside it. Rest and exercise are vital to health.
Well, quite.
Then there is Deacon Chamber.
Who’s he when he’s at home?
I think Sesha means that big metal box? Part oven, part washing machine? A decontamination chamber!
When I take the guards away, go into the Rest Centre and wait. There are only my father’s guards in there - the ones the Takers made sleep. The passcode is 7-4-3-9-7.
You're giving us our own way in?
My father trusted his first instincts. Mine are to trust you. I’1l come for you as soon as I can. (SESHA LEAVES)
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 24
When she said Purity. I wasn’t expecting a trailer park. And
that disinfectant smell...
Look at those guards Sesha’s leading away.
Their skin... Burnt raw, just the same as hers’.
I’d imagine everyone here’s the same.
And their clothes...
Standard issue coveralls for extended space travel.
I meant, starched stiff?
That’1l be too many turns through Sesha’s ‘deacon chamber’.
daresay the original meaning’s been lost over the years...
Well, Sesha’s as good as her word. The way’s clear...
I only wish Nyssa and Turlough were safe here, too.
Safe-?!?
Relatively speaking. Come on. Keep low.
THEY MOVE AWAY TO THE REST CENTRE
I
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 25
SCENE 14: EXT. RIVERSIDE/STERILE FOREST ZONE. DAWN
(FX: A DIFFERENT ATMOSPHERE. NO SHADES. JUST QUIETER NIGHT NOISES, AND THE RIVER, RUSHING ALONG. )
(NYSSA’S MADE IT TO THE RIVER BANK, SHE COUGHS, SHIVERY, SOAKED AND COLD. TURLOUGH’S BESIDE HER, HE’S BEEN UNCONSCIOUS IN THE
Turlough? Can you hear me?
COUGHS) What happened? (COUGHS AGAIN
They hit you on the head. A stone, I think.
Feels more like a boulder.
I tried to keep your head out of the water but couldn’t fight the current.
Probably as well, took us out of their reach.
But further away from the Doctor and Tegan.
Why did those two have to charge off at the first sniff of trouble?
It’s my fault as well, you waited for me when the Shades... (BREAKS OFF) Listen.
What is it?
The Shades, they’ve gone. There aren’t any.
Not a whisper... And the air... smells fresher, cleaner. (CHOKES) I thought the water was polluted?
It is, it stinks of carbolic.
It did stink of chemicals. (SMACKS LIPS) This stuff tastes pure as a mountain spring.
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 26
(WARY) Where are we, I wonder?
I don’t know. But it’s getting lighter. Maybe this place improves with daylight?
Come on, we’d better find a way back to the TARDIS — and hope we don’t run into anyone else on the way...
SCENE 15: INT. MEDICAL CENTRE. DAWN
FX: SOUND OF ENTRY CODER AND DOOR SLIDES OPEN
Here we are. Rest Centre. (DOOR CLOSES) No Shades in here.
Not much of anything in here. Just beds and showers.
A little more powerful than that, they’re steam-soakers. Some of this equipment on the far wall is rather more interesting.
In your opinion.
An old virtual reality generator. (FX: FLICKS SWITCHES) No power... (BANGS ON THE MACHINE)
Not so loud! You’1l wake Anulf’s guards. (WALKS OVER) They’re both still well under.

And a sleep-inducer! Promotes restful sleep. Or did once. (STUDIES IT) Scarring on the front panel, suggestive of a high- intensity energy blast... Aha! Similar markings on the VR unit. But why have a device that stimulates the brain right beside one that calms it — hmm?
Maybe they were moved in here later.
I wonder — did the Takers use the sleep inducer to knock out the guards?
I don’t think so. Look here at their wrists.
DOCTOR CROSSES, EXAMINES GUARDS
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 27
Injector marks. Shallow breathing, pupils dilated. They’ve been drugged. A sedative of some kind.
But we heard Anulf shout out. Why wasn’t he sedated?
Perhaps these two took his share of the dose. (FX: SOUND OF
CODER AND DOORS OPENING) Down!
MERTIL, ANTAN AND JESTAN AND SOME MEN ENTER
Hold tight, Jestan. You and your group have earned your rest.
The other parties will return soon. Better steam-soak while it’s quiet, Antan...
ANTAN HAS SEEN DOCTOR OR TEGAN. TERROR
Jestan! Behind the bunks —
GENERAL REACTION OF ALARM AND HORROR
There’s really no need to be afraid.
More Takers?
So - retaliation is swift.
Retaliation? There must be some confusion - Sister Sesha let us in here.
Not even Sesha would be so suicidally stupid.
She wants to present us to everyone at once precisely to avoid this reaction in smaller groups.
Look at them.
Not all this again.
Don’t be afraid, Jestan. The Taker and his acolyte ran from us in the forest. They fear our purity.
PURITY by Stephen Cole Page 28
Why not find Sesha, she’1ll vouch for us.
We only want to help.
Yes, to help poison that girl’s weak mind further! Jestan, use
